intro: Echium modestum var. masguindalii, commonly known as the Guadalcanal blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant floral display.
